main event: Two witnesses observed an orange-red light slowly descend from the Northwest and then gradually fade away.
interesting points: The object was described as being 5-10 times the size of a star and smaller than a commercial aircraft., The observation lasted approximately 1-3/4 hours from first sighting to complete disappearance., Witnesses reported seeing two bright, red-orange objects maneuvering in the sky for approximately 30 minutes., The reported maneuvers and changes in speed and direction are not consistent with known aircraft or other conventional explanations., The weather conditions during the sighting were clear with no cloud cover.
